title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Baking spice and vanilla aromas are at the fore, followed by blue fruit and barrel spices. The barrel influence (71% new French and American) leads on the palate as well, with abundant vanilla flavors that wash over the fruit. There's some good fruit underneath, if you can get to it.

title: Clos La Soleya NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: This full, foamy and aggressive sparkler gives off peach and nectarine aromas with an odd hint of scrambled egg. It's dry on the palate, with modest stone fruit flavors that turn bitter on the finish.

title: Pighin 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Round and friendly, this opens with aromas of banana and tropical fruit. The scents carry over to the ripe fruity palate along with yellow apple and a hint of lemon peel.

title: 14 Hands NV Brut Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of lemon, apple, pineapple, toast and spice lead to just off-dry flavors. It drinks a little sweet for a brut but still delivers enjoyment—a straightforward crowd pleaser.

title: Acquiesce 2015 Viognier (Lodi)
description: A relatively light-tasting wine from a sometimes heavy grape variety, this shows a mix of savory and fruit flavors, including cucumber, celery and white pepper. It tastes dry and almost austere, which is appealing in the right pairing, such as with goat cheese on toast.

title: AuburnJames 2012 Speedster Red (North Coast)
description: This brawny, dry wine has oak, tannin and body in big portions, its dark color leading to cut wood aromas, tart black cherry and blackberry flavors and a firm, somewhat drying texture. It needs rich food as a pairing or more time in the bottle to mellow.

title: Beronia 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This standard Verdejo is light on acidity, which is reflective of a hot year. Its citrus and green herb notes are fresh and prickly while its melon and thyme flavors lose intensity on the slightly bitter finish.

title: Cave de Saumur NV De Chanceny Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This crisp and fruity wine is bright with tight apple and grapefruit flavors. It is cool, with a strongly mineral streak and considerable youthful acidity. This bottling will be better from 2018.

title: Cellars 33 2016 The Betty White (Lodi)
description: This is a well-proportioned, pleasantly balanced wine made from white Rhône grape varieties. It has plenty of fruit and a smooth, almost soft texture. Fresh apple and pear aromas meet nutmeg and vanilla flavors on the palate.

title: Chacewater 2016 Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is so colorful it almost glows. The bright pink hue is a clue to the vivid raspberry and strawberry flavors that follow, giving an almost sweet, candied effect on the palate and finish.

title: Château Haut-Rian 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Owner Michel Dietrich takes the vegan route with no animal derivatives in fining the wine. The wine is taut and tight, with a steely texture that needs to soften. All its fruit is there, muted by the herbal edge and nervy texture. Drink from late 2017.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2013 Luzón Roble Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell's cherry and cassis aromas show a rough, oaky burn. It's grippy and a touch raw on the palate, with roasted berry and plum flavors that linger into the finish.

title: Boeger 2016 Primitivo Rosé (El Dorado)
description: As if its electric pink color wasn't enough to attract attention, this medium-bodied wine has effusive candied fruit aromas and just-picked red fruit flavors. Flavor intensity and good acidity give it a lot of personality.

title: Bridlewood 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Deep black plum aromas are enhanced by soy and crushed graphite on the nose of this bottling. It lands on the palate softly, with tangy plum and turned loam flavors, its tannins sticky and persistent.

title: Hightower 2013 Estate Red (Red Mountain)
description: Petit Verdot (38%) takes the lead on this blend, followed by Cabernet Sauvignon (26%), Merlot (12%), Cabernet Franc (12%) and Malbec. The aromas come off as leafy and green, with notes of dates, flowers and spice. The palate is quite light and elegant, not having the heft to stand on its own. The extraction seems dialed way back.

title: Mount Veeder 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed oak and funky earthiness permeate the nose and palate of this wine, with punchy cedar and bay notes. It lingers long on forest floor, pine and other woodsy components through its medium-bodied ripeness and structure.

title: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a sharp-edged wine with green-tinged fruits—apples and pears not quite ripe. It pushes accents of herb and stem forward, and will probably drink best with food rather than on its own.

title: Gorman 2014 Old Scratch G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 80% Syrah, 10% Mourvèdre and 10% Grenache. It brings unusual aromas of sawdust, mushroom, Band Aid, dark fruit and spice. The palate is lush and full, showing warmth on the finish.

title: Lomas del Valle 2014 Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)
description: This Cab Franc bears a “cool climate” designation, and that's confirmed on the nose, which is highly herbal and green, with a blast of eucalyptus and juniper. A raw grabby underdeveloped palate tastes of leafy plum and berry fruits, while the finish feels scratchy due to drawing tannins.
designation: Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard

title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2014 Ea! Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This Tempranillo's oaky berry aromas are solid but standard. It shows moderate buttery oak and plum flavors, tasting mostly of creamy oak on a finish propped up by acidity.

title: Gancedo 2009 Xestal Mencía (Bierzo)
description: The 2009 vintage was a hot one, so this wine's stewy, overripe aromas and deep, advanced color aren't shocking. In the mouth, it's generous with raisiny, ripe berry fruit, feeling undeniably heavy.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2015 Syrah-Grenache (Terra Alta)
description: This blend of Syrah and Garnacha feels blocky and rubbery. Floral raspberry and blueberry aromas come with baking spice notes, particularly cinnamon. Ripe raspberry flavors finish with a dash of chocolate and a touch of salt.

title: Le Casque 2014 Adrian Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: An earthy, leathery aromatic character carries over to the palate of this wine, joined by ripe plum flavors. The blend here is 53% Mourvèdre and 47% Syrah, feeling full-bodied, firmly tannic and ready for cassoulet.

title: Lion-Gri 2006 Golden Land Dry Chardonnay (Moldova)
description: Straw-colored in the glass, this wine has aromas of white and yellow peach, with flavors of passion fruit and pineapple. It's amazing that it is more than 10 years old. The wine has good mouthfeel and is well balanced with a crisp, clean finish. Drink now or hold for a few years.

title: McWilliam's 2014 Cool Climate Chardonnay (Australia)
description: Slightly smoky grilled-toast aromas lead into a plump medium-bodied wine filled with flavors of yellow plum, tangerine and lime. It's not particularly zesty or linear in a true cool-climate fashion, but steers clear of ripe tropical fruit, ending on a gentle note of citrus pith. Drink now.

title: Minkov Brothers 2011 Le Photographe Rheinriesling Riesling (Thracian Valley)
description: Aromas of lemon-lime, jasmine and honeysuckle prepare the palate for crisp, clean flavors of lemon zest and lemon curd.

title: Minkov Brothers 2014 Le Photographe Cabernet Franc (Thracian Valley)
description: This ruby-colored wine offers aromas of black cherry and notes of green pepper and summer farmstand. It has flavors of black cherry, cherry cola and cassis, with soft tannins and a bright burst of acidity in the finish.

title: Lambert 2014 A Thousand Words Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)
description: Medium to full in weight and opulent in texture, this is a buttery creamy wine that reflects its South Australian origin. Broad and rich, it's a throwback to a previous generation's style of Chardonnay.

title: Re Manfredi 2016 Rosato (Basilicata)
description: Made with Aglianico, this shows red-berry, wildflower and Mediterranean herb aromas. Fresh and straightforward, the palate gives juicy morello cherry and a light note of dark spice. Bright acidity gives it a clean, refreshing finish.

title: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)
description: For a Vinho Verde, this is smooth. With the a creamy texture along with bread fruit and lime flavors, the wine is soft. There is acidity to give a lift perfectly judged to keep this attractively crisp at the end. Drink now.
